Term_Definition: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample according to EMO BON Handbook as added by the sampling operators. This identifier is not quality controled but remains unchanged. This identifier consists of 5 terms: 1) Project (Â“EMOBONÂ”) 2) Sampling Site ID; that is the Observatory ID (for example Â“SMN99Â”) supplemented with the sampling site indicator (Â“WaÂ” for water column, Â“SoÂ” for soft substrates and Â“HaÂ” for hard substrates) 3) Sampling Campaign Date formated as YYMMDD.For example Â“220315Â” would be the campaign on 15 March 2022. Especially for Hard substrates, both the deployment and retrieval dates have to be recorded formated as YYMMDD-YYMMDD 4) Size fraction (Wa: Â“3umÂ” / Â“0.2umÂ” / Â“20umÂ” / Â“200umÂ”) or organisms collected (So: Â“microÂ” for microorganisms, Â“meioÂ” for meiobenthos and Â“macroÂ” for macrobenthos) or ARMS fraction (Ha: Â“SFÂ” for sessile fraction, Â“MF500Â” for motile fraction sieved through 0.5 mm, Â“MF100Â” for motile fraction sieved through 0.1 mm) 5) Replicate number (1-4). For labelling the negative control, this term will be replaced by the notation Â“blankÂ”. All terms must be separated by "_"..Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Required_value_and_units: text in specific format (unique sample id)

Term_Definition: Unique dentifier to each row/sample: it consists of the terms 1) Project (Â“EMOBONÂ”) 2) Sampling Site ID; that is the Observatory ID (for example Â“SMN99Â”) supplemented with the sampling site indicator (Â“WaÂ” for water column, Â“SoÂ” for soft substrates and Â“HaÂ” for hard substrates) and 3) an iterator (1,2,3 etc). This is created via a google equation. To add this identifier to a new row, simply drag the value from the cell above. This column can only be filled by EMBRC.Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Required_value_and_units: text in specific format (unique sample id)

Term_Definition: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample during the analysis and specifies an analysis stage, a step or a differentiation in the pipeline. The source material identifiers analysis consists of the source material identifiers ("source_mat_id") and a short analysis identifier. The short analysis identifier can be "metag" for metagenomics, "its metab" for ITS metabarcoding, "2nd time" for a sample that failed and is analyzed again. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Required_value_and_units: text in specific format (unique sample id and analysis id)

Term_Definition: Reference code given by EMO BON to the sample during packaging and cataloguing. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Reference code given by the sequencing centre to the original sample they receive; usually this reference code is used until DNA extraction and is then substituted by the reference code sequencing centre (DNA). Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Reference code given by the sequencing centre to the DNA extracted from a sample during analysis; usually this reference code is used after DNA extraction and is included in the sequencing reads filename. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag". Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Total number of clones sequenced from the library. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Specify whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies (e.g. for metabarcoding). If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag". In the metabarcoding framework this can take values "18S" or "COI". Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag". Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
The length of the amplicon in basepairs. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag". Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag". Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Required_value_and_units: text (FWD: forward primer sequence;REV:reverse primer sequence)

Term_Definition: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Description of reaction conditions and components of PCR in the form of  'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag". Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA,ENA or DRA. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Model of the sequencing instrument used; e.g. Illumina HiSeq 1000, Illumina NovaSeq 6000, Ion Torrent Proton. Permitted values are taken from the ENA Raw Read submission requirements (https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submit/reads/webin-cli.html). Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
DNA concentration measured after DNA extraction. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Method used to measure the DNA concentration after DNA extraction. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Total DNA quantity calculated from the DNA concentration measured after extraction. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Library source workflow followed: METAGENOMIC, GENOMIC, GENOMIC SINGLE CELL, TRANSCRIPTOMIC, TRANSCRIPTOMIC SINGLE CELL, METATRANSCRIPTOMIC, SYNTHETIC, VIRAL RNA, OTHER. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Required_value_and_units: text, select from the list: METAGENOMIC, GENOMIC, GENOMIC SINGLE CELL, TRANSCRIPTOMIC, TRANSCRIPTOMIC SINGLE CELL, METATRANSCRIPTOMIC, SYNTHETIC, VIRAL RNA, OTHER

Term_Definition: Reference name given by the sequencing centre to a specific sequencing run. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced from re-sequencing. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding prokaryotes mock community sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the prokaryote mock community included in the same sequencing run as the sample. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding eukaryotes mock community sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the eukaryote mock community included in the same sequencing run as the sample. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: relevant electronic resources for the sequencing work
Term_Definition: Relevant electronic resources for the sequencing molecular work. Resources may be provided for any of the steps/methods followed. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: relevant standard operating procedures for the sequencing work
Term_Definition: Standard operating procedures used in the sequencing molecular work. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Umbrella study accession number is a unique identifier given to an umbrella study once the sample is registered to ENA (European Nucleotide Archive). It refers to a specific umbrella study and connected to all the projects, samples, sequencing runs and data included. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Project accession number is a unique identifier given to aproject once the sample is registered to ENA (European Nucleotide Archive). It refers to a specific project and connected to all the samples, sequencing runs and data included. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding extraction blank sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the extraction blank included in the same sequencing run as the sample. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding 1st pcr blank sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the 1st PCR sequencing blank included in the same sequencing run as the sample. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding 2nd pcr blank sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the 2nd PCR sequencing blank included in the same sequencing run as the sample. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Batch of EMO BON samples processed together for DNA extraction, sequencing, and data acquisition. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
Any additional comment related to this source_mat_id. Write NA if you will not ever provide a value for this term.
